lead_paragraph: As university enrollment surges in China, apathy and poor teaching are eating away at advantages seen in primary and secondary schools, research out of Stanford suggests.

byline.contributor: Zhang Tiantian and Karoline Kan contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Chinese Students Better in Thinking, Till College
headline.main: Study Finds Chinese Students Excel in Critical Thinking. Until College.

snippet: As university enrollment surges in China, apathy and poor teaching are eating away at advantages seen in primary and secondary schools, research out of Stanford suggests....
abstract: Study by researchers at Stanford University finds primary and secondary students in China have some of strongest critical thinking skills in world, but loose advantage upon entering college; findings draw attention to poor quality of teaching and student burnout in China's stagnant higher education system, which is badly in need of reforms.
